originalTitle: Powerful cyclone kills at least 31 as it tears through Madagascar port
title: Powerful cyclone kills at least 31 as it tears through Madagascar port
content: Madagascar's disaster management says roads are inaccessible with trees uprooted, power poles down and ninety percent of roofs ripped off.

originalTitle: South African Epstein survivor calls on UK Royal Family to search Andrew's files
title: A Brave Voice from Sunny South Africa!
content:
Hello, Amazing Explorers and Super Readers!

Hello everyone! Your friendly news reporter from the beautiful continent of Africa is here with a very important and inspiring story today. It's about a very brave lady from our own sunny South Africa. Her name is Juliette, and she is showing us all how important it is to speak up and be heard, especially when you need answers to big questions.

Meet Juliette from South Africa!

Juliette Bryant is a wonderful and brave lady, and she comes all the way from South Africa, a country famous for its sunshine, amazing animals, and friendly people! She has a very important message for some very important people in another country called the United Kingdom, or the UK for short. Juliette is asking them to do something very helpful and important. She wants them to listen carefully and to look for answers. Did you know? South Africa is home to many incredible animals like lions, elephants, and giraffes! It's a land of vibrant cultures and languages, making it a very special place on our continent.

What is Juliette Asking For?

Imagine you have a big puzzle, and some pieces are missing. Juliette is feeling a bit like that. She is asking a very special family, called the Royal Family, to 'act' on some important questions. This means she wants them to really pay attention and do something about some things that happened a while ago. She wants them to look very closely at some important papers or 'files' that belong to one of their family members, Prince Andrew. It's like asking a grown-up to help you search for a lost toy that has all the answers inside!

Who is the Royal Family?

The Royal Family is a very old and famous family in the United Kingdom. Think of them like a very special family whose job it is to represent their country. The Queen, who is like a grandmother to the whole country, used to be their leader, and now her son, King Charles, is the King. They live in big, beautiful homes called Palaces, which are like super-duper castles! Prince Andrew is one of the members of this important family. Juliette is asking this family, and especially the people who work in their Palace, to help find some answers. Did you know? The Royal Family has been around for hundreds and hundreds of years! They have a long history filled with kings, queens, princes, and princesses. Their main home in London is called Buckingham Palace, and it's enormous!

What Are These 'Files' or 'Papers'?

When Juliette talks about 'files' or 'papers,' she means important records. These are like very special notebooks, documents, or computer folders that hold lots of information. Grown-ups keep files for many reasons: to remember things, to keep track of events, or to make sure everything is done correctly. When we want to understand something that happened in the past, or when we need to check facts, we often look at these kinds of papers. Juliette believes that by looking at Prince Andrew's files, important information can be found that will help everyone understand things better and make sure everything is fair and right.

Why is Finding the Truth So Important?

Imagine you and your friends are playing a game, and someone isn't sure about the rules. To make sure the game is fair and fun for everyone, you would check the rulebook, right? It's the same idea with big life questions. When there are questions about things that happened, finding the truth is super important. It helps us understand what is fair, what is right, and how we can make sure everyone feels safe and respected. Juliette wants the truth to come out so that everyone can learn from it and feel better. Did you know? Speaking the truth, even when it's hard, makes you a very strong and trustworthy person! It helps build trust between people and makes our communities safer and kinder for everyone.

The Power of Speaking Up!

Juliette is showing us all that even if you feel small or like your voice won't be heard, it's always important to speak up when you believe something isn't right or when you need answers. Being brave like Juliette and sharing your story can make a huge difference. Her brave request reminds all the grown-ups in charge, and indeed all of us, that we must listen when someone asks for help or for justice. It helps everyone feel more understood and shows that every voice, no matter how quiet it may seem at first, can make a big change in the world. This is a story about bravery, asking questions, and the big idea of truth and fairness. We hope that Juliette's call for action will help bring answers and clarity for everyone involved, making our world a fairer place for all. Did you know? A 'Palace' is not just a home; it's also a place where important decisions and meetings happen. It's like the heart of the Royal Family's work! Thank you for listening to this important news from Africa!
summary: A brave lady from South Africa named Juliette is asking the Royal Family in the UK to look at some important old papers to find answers about things that happened in the past.
whyMatters: This is important because it teaches us that everyone's voice counts, and when someone bravely asks to find the truth, we should listen carefully to make sure everyone is safe, happy, and treated fairly.

title: Forest open Pereira talks after sacking Dyche
content: Nottingham Forest sack Sean Dyche as head coach after just 114 days in charge, with former Wolves boss Vitor Pereira in talks to replace him.

originalTitle: Man City 'breathing down Arsenal's neck' as title 'belief' grows
title: Man City 'breathing down Arsenal's neck' as title 'belief' grows
content: Pep Guardiola vowed his Manchester City side would "breathe down the neck of Arsenal" as they aim to hunt down the Premier League leaders in this fascinating title race.

originalTitle: PM tells Ratcliffe to apologise for 'colonised' remarks
title: PM tells Ratcliffe to apologise for 'colonised' remarks
